pageContext.claim: “I think it's a very dangerous decision because you're going to have one or two or three states, depending on how it ends up, where they're tabulating ballots, and the rest of the world is waiting to find out. And I think there's great danger to it, and I think a lot of fraud and misuse could take place...we don't want to have Pennsylvania, where you have a political governor -- a very partisan guy -- and we don't want to have other states -- like Nevada, where you have the head of the Democratic clubhouse as your governor. We don't want to be in a position where he's allowed to, every day, watch ballots come in. 'Gee, if we could only find 10,000 more ballots.'”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is referring to court rulings attempting to accommodate the vast number of mail-in ballots. He baselessly suggests this will give Democrats a chance to fiddle with the election results and sneak in fraudulent ballots -- which was one of the false claims he made after he lost the election.
